messages.title: Labour’s investment in our railways
messages.content: Labour’s investment in our railways and the £200m plans for the electrification of the Preston to Manchester line is great news for Heaton and Lostock.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in our rail network and electrify the Manchester to Preston line.
Help families and businesses until the recovery is established and halve the deficit in 4 years by economic growth and fair taxes on those earning the most.
Guarantee diagnosis in 1 week if GP suspects you have cancer.
Take tough action on the minority of people behaving anti-socially and making people's lives miserable.

mentions.candidate: Julie Hilling is a campaigner who believes that the needs of local residents and the local community are foremost. Julie has lived and worked in Bolton for 24 years.

issues.socialWelfare: Labour's Sure Start Children's Centres are under threat from Tory cuts.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am first and foremost a campaigner who believes that the needs of local residents and the local community are foremost.

politicalExperience.role: Parliamentary Candidate for Heaton and Lostock
politicalExperience.duration: Has lived in Bolton West for 24 years
politicalExperience.achievements: Working hard on the issues that you care about.

images.caption: Julie Hilling with members of the local community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Julie Hilling has been involved in the community locally and supports groups such as Bolton Against Racism (BAR), Befriending Refugees and Asylum Seekers (BRASS), The Friends of Queens Park, and Bolton Wholefood Cooperative. She is backing our Neighborhood Policing team in tackling anti-social behavior issues in Heaton and Lostock.
